article.headline: South Alabama 71, Maine 59
article.story: MOBILE, Ala. -- LaShun Watson scored 13 of his career-high 15 points in the first half to lead South Alabama to a 71-59 victory over Maine on Friday night. Watson also grabbed seven rebounds to help the Jaguars (3-3) snap a two-game losing streak in the opening round of the USA Basketball Classic. South Alabama will face UC Davis in Saturday's championship game. The Jaguars built a 40-20 halftime advantage as Maine (3-3) started off 3 of 13 from the field. Mark Socoby scored 28 points to lead the Black Bears, who hit three 3-pointers at the start of the second half to cut the lead to 44-31 with 16:42 left. Brandon Davis, who led the Jaguars with 18 points, had 12 points and six rebounds in the second half. Domonic Tilford added 15 points and a career-high seven assists and DeAndre Coleman collected 11 points and six boards.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
